page.title: 12 BRERETON VILLAGE VANISHES?
page.content: What is a village? "An assemblage, of houses etc, smaller than a town" says a dictionary. "A friendly, caring atmosphere" say many Brereton residents Brereton grew to be a mining village within it's own parish from Saxon times Today Brereton has many amenities including a Resident's Society. It has lost it's Parish Council and policeman. It is called "Rugeley", it's neighbouring town's name, by the Post Office. Is it still a village? "Yes" say 150 of 230 residents questioned, "and it should stay that way" 37 locals believe that with a population of 7000 and no clear demarcation between Rugeley and Brereton what was once a village is now a suburb. They regret it's loss of identity. 43 residents contentedley believe Brereton to be part of Rugeley. Will Brereton Village vanish?
